arm_group.description: Stimulation performed with body temperature control

brief_summary.textblock:
An investigation into the relative effectiveness of thermal-aided muscle stimulation vs.
      body temperature muscle stimulation for eliciting muscle contraction in the quadriceps

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Subject does not meet any exclusion criteria

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Age < 18 years

          -  Subject is pregnant

          -  Subject has an implanted pacemaker/defibrillator

          -  Subject diagnosed with epilepsy

          -  Subject has implanted metallic femoral rods

          -  Subject is chair- or bed-bound

          -  Subject has neuromuscular disease or abnormalities

          -  Subject BMI > 45

          -  Evidence of disease or condition that, in the opinion of the investigator, may
             compromise the conduct of or results of the study

intervention.description: Thermal-aided muscle stimulation is applied to subject quadriceps (one leg) with Niveus Medical Muscle Stimulation System 110
Body temperature stimulation is applied to subject quadriceps (one leg) with Niveus Medical Muscle Stimulation System 110

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
